messages.message:
Greetings!

I was just wondering what your aims were regarding territory in the area? May I suggest that we keep Pie as a DMZ for the time being?
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'Greetings!

I was just wondering what your aims were regarding territory in the area? May I suggest that we keep Pie as a DMZ for the time being?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's diplomatic inquiry about France's intentions for territory in the area and proposition to maintain Piedmont as a demilitarized zone reflect a genuine effort towards establishing peaceful relations and setting clear boundaries.

messages.message: Sure, could we expand that DMZ all the way to Naf?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Sure, could we expand that DMZ all the way to Naf?'.

messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's agreement to expand the demilitarized zone all the way to Naf indicates a willingness to maintain peace and cooperation with France, consistent with the initial discussion about establishing a DMZ.

messages.message: So what is happening in the east?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'So what is happening in the east?'.

messages.message: Haven't really made plans with any of them yet. Going to see the opening moves
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Haven't really made plans with any of them yet. Going to see the opening moves'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's response indicating a lack of concrete plans with eastern powers and a strategy to observe the opening moves aligns with a cautious and observant approach often taken in the early phases of the game.

messages.message: I will retreat from pie. England and Russia told me you were going west. They made me break our dmz deal while england moved against me
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I will retreat from pie. England and Russia told me you were going west. They made me break our dmz deal while england moved against me'.

messages.message:
As long as you move out this turn I'll let you off. I can understand why you did it but at least now you know who you can trust

Well

Ish
messages.input:
Message from ITALY:'As long as you move out this turn I'll let you off. I can understand why you did it but at least now you know who you can trust

Well

Ish'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's response acknowledges France's situation, expresses understanding for their actions, and hints at the importance of trust and reliability in diplomatic interactions, fostering a sense of mutual understanding and potential future cooperation.

messages.message: England obviously wanted troubles kn my South
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'England obviously wanted troubles kn my South'.

messages.message: I am will surrender all my centers to england if you do not back off immediately
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I am will surrender all my centers to england if you do not back off immediately'.

messages.message: Days passed and someone disrespected my offer. I won't defend Marseille so you can use your fleet to support me in Spain. I think you would like to see England out of the Mediterranean. I am willing to help you defend Mediterranean as long as I can in order to survive at least.
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Days passed and someone disrespected my offer. I won't defend Marseille so you can use your fleet to support me in Spain. I think you would like to see England out of the Mediterranean. I am willing to help you defend Mediterranean as long as I can in order to survive at least.'.

messages.message: What army/fleet do you want supporting into Spain? I can agree to these terms
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'What army/fleet do you want supporting into Spain? I can agree to these terms'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's willingness to support France in Spain and inquire about the specific army/fleet support shows a clear intention to cooperate and follow through with the proposed plan, indicating a proactive and collaborative approach towards working together in the Mediterranean.

messages.message: Could you use Gol to support spain holding?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'Could you use Gol to support spain holding?'.
Message from ITALY:'Sure, consider it done'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's straightforward confirmation to support Spain holding with Gulf of Lyon demonstrates a clear and direct agreement, indicating a commitment to the proposed strategy and ongoing cooperation with France in the Mediterranean region.

messages.input: My response to ITALY:'You can have Marseille'.

messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's brief response of "Cheers" upon receiving Marseille from France indicates an amicable acceptance of the offered territory, portraying a positive and cooperative attitude in their interaction.

messages.message: I am supporting Tys to Wes. Can you use Mar to support spain hold?
messages.input: My response to ITALY:'I am supporting Tys to Wes. Can you use Mar to support spain hold?'.

messages.message: Aye, that's locked in now. I'm using Tun to hopefully disrupt Naf as well
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Aye, that's locked in now. I'm using Tun to hopefully disrupt Naf as well'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's confirmation of using Marseille to support Spain hold as requested indicates a consistent and reliable approach to cooperation, aligning with the established plan and demonstrating a commitment to the agreed-upon strategy in the Mediterranean.

messages.message: Do you reckon you could do Spa S Wes?
messages.input: Message from ITALY:'Do you reckon you could do Spa S Wes?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Italy's request for France to support Spain holding with Western Mediterranean indicates a continued alignment in their strategic cooperation and a clear communication of intentions, reinforcing a collaborative approach between the two nations.
